availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ambrose Bramlette Long (Lamar County, Texas, clerk and soldier (C.S.A.))

body.p: Lamar County, Texas, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel Long and Margaret Berry Long. Resident of Clinton County, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk in Lamar County, Texas in 1860. Served in the 5th Texas Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a private from October 23, 1861 to unknown date. Signed a loyalty oath to the United States Government by February 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clinton County, District 2, p. 209B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Texas, Lamar County, Precinct 6, p. 119.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Texas, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M323, Roll 0158.
"Ambrose Bramlette Long (1839-1912)," Find A Grave, Memorial #37390119, accessed August 6, 2022.
KYR-0001-003-0042.
